newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government bonds lower on interbank rate.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government bonds lower on interbank rate.

text.p: Singapore government bonds were lower in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, following a mild recovery in the interbank rate, dealers said on Friday.
"Bond prices were marked down slightly today after the interbank rate gained some ground. But treasury bill yields were steady to slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.26/1.21 percent compared with Thursday's yield of 1.20/1.15 percent.
But one-year was unchanged from Thursday's yield of 1.31/1.26 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$99.51/99.56 against Thursday's close of S$99.54/99.59, March 2001 at S$99.68/99.73 from S$99.70/99.75 and June 2003 at S$99.50/99.55 versus S$99.53/99.58.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 4 3-7/8 percent against Thursday's 3-3/4 3-5/8 percent.
